result.execSummary:
The defendant Cory S. Griffiths was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and stayed, with work release/huber in the event of revocation and 1 day credit.

Conditions:

Attend, pay for and successfully complete any programming and/or counseling ordered by the agent.

Pay court costs and costs of supervision.  

Pay restitution in the amount of $1839.72 to the Crime Victim Witness Fund.

(If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.)

1 day credit in the event of revocation.

Defendant to submit to DNA sampling at the Richland County Sheriff's Department before signing up for probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cory S. Griffiths in court with attorney Dominic J. Anderson. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand (for DA Harper) appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. A states that parties have reached an agreement for resolution calling for amendment of the single felony count to two misdemeanor charges without repeaters for 2 years probation with 6 mo jail stayed and conditions of no drink as well as any assts/treatment as recommended by agent, costs, and restitution of $1839.72.  ADA Forehand moves for amendment of count 1 to misdemeanor battery per 940.19(1) and then for addition of count 2/misdemeanor d.c. per 947.01.  Court allows amendments.  Def pleads no contest to the two misdemeanor counts.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  Counsel address the Court.

Sentence: 6 mo jail on Count 1 and 3 mo jail on Count 2, concurrent and stayed for 2 years probation with conditions as follows: attend, pay for, and successfully complete any programming or counseling ordered by the agent; costs; $1839.72 restitution, paid to Crime Victim Witness Fund.  Costs and restitution conditions of probation.

Court orders def to submit DNA sample at Richland County Sheriff's Department before reporting today to Richland County P/P.

Defendant Cory S. Griffiths in court with attorney Dominic J. Anderson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Anderson appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Cory S. Griffiths in court with attorney Dominic J. Anderson.  Counsel ask for plea/sentencing date; have an agreed-upon resolution.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 09:03 am.

Defendant Cory S. Griffiths in court with attorney Dominic J. Anderson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Today was to be date for prelim.  DA advises the Court that the def wants to waive the prelim.  Atty. A confirms.  Court's colloquy with def re prelim waiver.  DA asks for arraignment scheduling.  Arraignment scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Cory S. Griffiths in court with attorney Dominic J. Anderson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  DA Harper - parties jointly request adj. of prelim.  Matter adj. to April 1 at 9.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Cory S. Griffiths in court with attorney Dominic J. Anderson. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer Alleman Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty. A has not received the complaint yet.  Court states the charges and informs def of the possible max. penalties including right to prelim.  Defense waives prelim times limits.  Court conducts colloquy re time limits waiver.  Prelim set for 2/4 at 9.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 4, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on November 26, 2014 at 10:00 am.

DA Harper and Def without counsel.  Court notes that the penalties, as stated by the State in the complaint, are not correct; due to the enhancer, charge is a felony.  Court states the charge and informs def of rights including right to counsel.  Def asks for adjournment to be able to retain counsel - plans to retain Atty. Bradley.  Court sets adjourned initial for Nov. 26 at 10.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 11-26-2014 at 10:00 am.
